intro: Aniseia emarginata, commonly known as the broadleaf arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its distinctive spatulate leaves and inflorescence. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in a spadix, typical of the Araceae family. Its rhizomes are used as a starchy food source, similar to taro. The leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
